1.title: Tsaani : the Grizzly Bear Story
1.author: art work by Dimi Macheras.
notes: Preface signed in type: Katherine Wade.
Copyright by Chickaloon Village Traditional Council.

Summary: "Out matched in strength and speed, faced with seemingly impossible odds, how will the Brave survive the ferocious Grizzly Bear? With only his wits and determination at his disposal, the young man will be put to the test in this ancient Athabascan tale."

18.heading: Tsang, Hiuen.
18.title: "Harsha : a Gallant King of Kanauj"
18.author: script, Yagya Sharma, Anand Prakash Singh ; illustrations, Madhu Powle ; editor, Anant Pai
18.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 627 (1972, 2010 printing).
notes: "Starting off as the ruler of tiny Thaneshwar, Harsha (7th century AD) rose to become the powerful monarch of the kingdom of Kanauj. He avenged the wicked assassination of his elder brother and the cowardly abduction of his sister. His biographer Bona Bhatta and the Chinese traveler Hiuen Tsang were unanimous in their praise of this learned king, whose fame did much to create a glowing image of India in lands far away."

51.title: Kagetora
51.author: Akira Segami ; translated by Akira Tsubasa ; adapted by Nunzio DeFilippis & Christina Weir.
notes: "First published in Japan in 2003 by Kodansha, Ltd., Tokyo"
Summary (from OCLC): Young ninja Kagetora has been given an impossible assignment
to teach the heir of a martial arts house the deft moves of self-defense and combat. The problem is that Yuki is clumsy and inept, but, even worse, Kagetora finds himself falling in love with her

52.title: Tsubasa
52.author: Clamp ; translated and adapted by Anthony Gerard [et al
notes: "First published in book form by Kodansha Ltd., Tokyo, in 2003"

Summary (from OCLC): Syaoran, Fai, Kurogane, and Mokona venture to the Hanshin Republic to find one of the missing pieces of Sakura's memory, transformed into magically powerful feathers. There, Syaoran meets his "Kudan": a fierce wolf-spirit whose fiery power mirrors Syaoran's personal strength. But with foes like a pop idol who sings words of pain, Syaoran's hunt for feathers is no child's game! Even if he finds the feathers, will Sakura ever wake up from her magical sleep? And since Syaoran bargained away their relationship in a pact with a witch, can their love ever return to the way it was?

59.heading: Tsuchiya, Garon.
59.title: Old Boy
59.author: story by Garon Tsuchiya ; art by Nobuaki Minegishi ; translation, Kumar Sivasubramanian ; lettering and retouch, Kathryn Renta.
notes: "Ten years ago, they took him. He doesn't know who. For ten years he has been confined in a private prison. He doesn't know why. For ten years his only contact with the outside world has been a television set and the voices of his jailers. In time, he lost himself. He changed

something lethal. Suddenly one day, his incarceration ends, again without explanation. He is sedated, stuffed inside a trunk, and dumped in a park. When he awakes, he is free to reclaim what's left of his life

67.heading: Tsuge, Yoshiharu, 1937- --Articles About.
67.title: "Hey Kids! Gekiga
67.author: by Bill Randall
67.appears_in: p. 107-111 in The Comics Journal, no. 245 (Aug. 2002).
notes: Examines the works of Yoshiharu Tsuge and Imiri Sakabashira.

68.heading: Tsuge, Yoshiharu, 1937- --Articles About.
68.title: "Yoshiharu Tsuge : un Homme et son Oeuvre"
68.author: Mitsuhiro Asakawa ; notes et traduction, Béatrice Maréchal
68.appears_in: p. 62-68 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: Begins: "Yoshiharu Tsuge, que l'on découvre enfin en France grâce à Ego comme x, est un auteur qui a toujours privilégié la recherche créative. Au-delà des générations et des cultures, son oeuvre touche un lectorat universel. Si elle résonne en nous, c'est parce qu'il a su continuellement maintenir ses exigences artistiques, et que, ce faisant, il a dépassé sa propre solitude, son désespoir récurrent, trouvant le moyen de s'en délivrer en fixant son regard sur les beautés du monde."

English summary (from p. 127): "Yoshiharu Tsuge : a Man and His Works. This artist, who was first discovered by Garo, now finally made known in France by Ego Comme X, has always favored creative research. A secretive artist with a depressive tendancy, Tsuge has not published anything since 1987, but his largely autobiographic work exerts an influence that extends beyond the field of manga, as shown by the numerous cinema adaptations it has inspired. Mitsuhiro Asakawa reveals Tsuge's powerful originality."
